Name: Mew
Flavour: Apparently, it appears only to those people who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to see it.
Description: Once per turn, you can pay 1 mana, this card’s effect becomes another face-up monster’s effect for rest this turn.

Name: Unown
Flavour: Unown is just like Man; it dies to Pokemon with move. But for those who are unprepared for Man's—or rather, Unown's, for they are one and the same—unpredictability, they too will fall.
Description: When this card is summoned, its name changes randomly.
if_summon:
c = random.randrange(28)
if c == 26: self.name = "Unown !"
elif c == 27: self.name = "Unown ?"
else: self.name = "Unown " + chr(c+ord("A"))

Name: Spright Elf
Description: When this card is summoned, you can pay 1 mana; summon a 2 cost monster from your graveyard to your field. While this card is on your field, adjacent 2-cost monsters on your field cannot be targeted.
if_summon:
card = select_other_graveyard(lambda card: card.type == "monster" and card.cost == 2)
owner.graveyard.remove(card)
idx = target_owner_board_empty()
io.summon(card, idx, owner)

Name: Magikarp
Flavour: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.

Name: Mudkip
Flavour: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to lift boulders.

Name: Pikachu
Flavour: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.

Name: Grovyle
Flavour: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

Name: Ampharos
Flavour: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.

Name: Blastoise
Flavour: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

Name: Wailord
Flavour: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.

Name: Snorlax
Flavour: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

Name: Garchomp
Flavour: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.

Name: Jirachi
Flavour: Once Jeffrey got iron head-flinched 5 times in a row: “skill diff”
Description: When this card is about to attack a monster: Flip two coins. If both are heads then the monster can no longer attack.
if_attack: c1 = flip_coin()\nc2 = flip_coin()\nif c1 and c2: args[0].status.append(("CANNOT_ATTACK", -1))

Name: Ho-oh
Flavour: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted trainer by shining its bright rainbow-colored wings.
Description: When this card is about to attack a monster: Half the other monster's attack

Name: Kyogre
Flavour: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.
Description: When this card is summoned: Change both player’s field spells to Rainy Day.

Name: Groudon
Flavour: It had been asleep in underground magma ever since it fiercely fought Kyogre long ago.
Description: When this card is summoned: Change both player’s field spells to Harsh Sunlight.

Name: Giratina
Flavour: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
Description: When a card would be destroyed as a result of battle with this card, banish it instead.

Name: Arceus
Flavour: It emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
Description: Once while face-up on the field: You can send all other cards on the field to the graveyard.

Name: Gallade
Flavour: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using the extending swords on its elbows.
Description: On attack declaration, flip a coin: if heads, this attack will deal 2x the attack of this monster.

Name: Heracross
Flavour: It loves sweet honey. To keep all the honey to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
Description: On attack declaration, flip a coin: if tails, this attack misses and deals no damage (this card still takes recoil).

Name: Shuckle
Flavour: It stores Berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

Name: Breloom
Flavour: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores
Description: If this card is summoned: You can target an opponent's monster, silence it and it cannot attack until after its next turn

Name: Chansey
Description: At the start of each turn: Heal adjacent friendly characters 200 health.
on_standby_phase: adjs = get_adjacent(self)\nfor adj in adjs:\n  adj.heal(200)

Name: Tyranitar
Description: At the end phase of each turn: Deal 100 to everything except “Tyranitar” cards.

Name: Gengar
Description: When this card would be destroyed by battle, you can target an opponent monster, silence it.

Name: Dragonite
Description: When this card is at full health and takes damage: Half the damage taken.

Name: Gyarados
Description: This card can only be summoned by destroying a “Magikarp” you control. When this card is summoned, reduce the attack of each of your opponent’s monsters by 100.

Name: Salamence
Description: When this card destroys another by battle, increase this card’s attack by 300.

Name: Lugia
Description: Once per turn: When this card is about to take damage: Half the damage taken.

Name: Lapras
Description: When this card is summoned, place a “Perish” counter on all face-up monsters on the field. During the end phase of the next turn, destroy all monsters with a Perish counter.

Name: Turtwig
Flavour: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
Description: At the end of each turn: Gain 50 health.

Name: Pokemon Safari
Description: At the beginning of each turn: Add a random 3 mana or lower Pokemon to your hand.

Name: Lavender Town
Description: Once per turn: When a pokemon dies, summon a 100/100 ghost.

Name: Switch Out!
Description: Return one of your Pokemon on the field to your hand. Summon a Pokemon from your deck with equal or lesser cost.

Name: Ultraball
Description: Banish a monster on the field. You can’t attack directly this turn.

Name: Repel
Description: Return an enemy monster to the opponent’s hand

Name: Squirt Bottle
Description: Target a monster on the field, silence it until the end of this turn

Name: Technical Machine
Description: Select a monster on the field; it gains +200/+200

Name: Pokemon Trade
Description: Send as many Pokemon as you’d like from your field to the graveyard. Summon a random Pokemon with cost equal to their total cost.

Name: Pokemon Shuffle
Description: Shuffle as many Pokemon as you’d like from the graveyard into your deck. Summon a random Pokemon with cost equal to the number of unique names sent.

Name: Spright Jet
Description: If this card is summoned: you can add 1 spell card from your deck to your hand that costs exactly 2 mana.

Name: Spright Blue
Description: If this card is summoned: you can add 1 monster card from your deck to your hand that costs exactly 2 mana.

Name: Spright Pixie
Description: You can tribute this card. Adjacent 2-cost monsters gain 100/100.

Name: Spright Starter
Description: Summon a 2 cost monster from your deck. Take damage equal to 2x its attack.

Name: Wind Up Kitten
Description: Once while on the field: you can pay 1 mana; return a monster from the field to the hand

Name: Live Twin Lil-la
Description: When this card is summoned, and you control a “Ki-sikil” monster, destroy a random card on your opponent’s side of the field

Name: Live Twin Ki-sikil
Description: When this card is summoned, and you control a “Lil-la” monster, draw a card.

Name: Live Twin Trouble Sunny
Description: You can send this card to the graveyard to summon up to one “Live Twin Lil-la” and up to one “Live Twin Ki-sikil” from your graveyard simultaneously.

Name: Live Twin’s Moonlit Snitch
Description: When this card is activated: You can add 1 "Live Twin" monster from your Deck to your hand. While you control a "Live Twin" monster, each time your opponent Normal Summons, you gain 100 LP, and if you do, inflict 100 damage to your opponent.

Name: Omen
Description: When this card is summoned: Target a monster: give it stealth.

Name: Brimstone
Description: While this card is on the field: Adjacent monsters gain 200 ATK

Name: Viper
Description: While this card is on the field: Opponent monsters in the 3 spaces in front of this monster lose 200 health (min. 1).

Name: Reyna
Description: When this card destroys another minion: heal 200 HP

Name: Cypher
Description: The opposing monster and adjacent monsters to this card can’t attack.

Name: Kiljoy
Description: Add a 1-cost "Kiljoy Turret" to hand

Name: Neon
Description: If an attack is directed at this monster: Flip a coin, if tails, the attack is negated

Name: Jett
Description: Once per summon: if this card is about to take lethal battle damage, it survives with 1 health.
if_take_battle_damage: if arg[0] >= self.health:\n  return self.health - 1\nreturn arg[0]

Name: Phoenix
Description: When this attacks, the opposing monster has 0 attack.

Name: 1-Tap
Description: Target a monster: deal 500 damage

Name: Shorty Angle
Description: Target a friendly monster: deal 500 damage to the opposing monster.

Name: Cloud Burst
Description: Target a monster: give it stealth. Add another “Cloud burst” to your hand.

Name: Odin Spam
Description: Deal damage to all opponent monsters equal to 150 x the number of monsters they control.

Name: Haven
Description: One “agent” can attack without taking damage each turn.

Name: Bind
Description: Once per turn: swap an “agent” monster to a new space

Name: Dart Monkey
Description: When this card is summoned, you can deal 100 damage to a monster on the field. If you do, add a 2 mana dart monkey to your hand.

Name: Super Monkey
Description: At the beginning of your turn: this card turns into "Sun Avatar."

Name: Super Monkey Fan Club
Description: Convert all monkeys on your side of the field to Super Monkeys. At the end of this turn, convert them back.

Name: Ancient Ruins
Description: Summon as many Unown as you can to your side of the field.

Name: Lopunny
Flavour: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
Description: When this card is summoned, target one monster on the field; deal 100 damage to it.

Name: Mega Lopunny
Description: When this card is summoned, target one monster on the field; deal 100 damage to it, and if you do, it is silenced and cannot attack until the end of the next turn. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except Mega Lopunny.

Name: Beedrill
Flavour: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.
Description: When this card attacks a monster, that monster takes 100 damage at the end of your turn.

Name: Mega Beedrill
Description: When this card attacks a monster, all of your “Beedrill” cards everywhere gain 100/100. When this card attacks directly, reduce its cost to 0, return it to your hand. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except Mega Beedrill.

Name: Charizard
Flavour: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

Name: Mega Charizard X
Description: In the standby phase of each turn: This card gains 300 attack. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except “Mega Charizard”.

Name: Mega Charizard Y
Description: This card does not take battle damage when attacking. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except “Mega Charizard”.

Name: Mega Heracross
Description: This card cannot attack. In your end phase deal 100 damage 8 times randomly to opponent monsters. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except “Mega Heracross”.

Name: Mega Snorlax
Description: Opponent minions must attack this monster first. Spells do half damage to this monster. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except “Mega Snorlax”.

Name: Mega Scizor
Description: When this card is summoned, do 250 damage to the lowest health enemy monster. If it dies, do this again. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except “Mega Scizor”.

Name: Mega Kangaskhan
Description: This card can attack twice. The second attack does half damage. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except “Mega Kangaskhan”.

Name: Sableye
Description: If this card is summoned, target an enemy monster: Reduce its attack by half.

Name: Mega Sableye
Description: Your monsters are unaffected by opponent’s card effects. You cannot summon any “Mega” for the rest of this duel, except “Mega Sableye”.

Name: Ditto
Description: When Ditto is summoned, target one monster on the field. This card becomes that card, except for the HP stat.

Name: Eevee
Description: Choose one: Gain +200 attack, Gain +200 health, Gain Stealth

Name: Mega Bracelet
Description: Send a Pokemon to the graveyard from your hand, field, or deck; Summon a Mega Pokemon from your extra deck that mentions it and pay its mana cost

Name: Mega Mewtwo X
Description: When this card is summoned, deal 600 damage to yourself, then you can deal 1000 damage to your opponent. If this card is destroyed, draw 3 cards.

Name: Mega Mewtwo Y
Description: When this card is summoned, deal 1000 damage to yourself, then you can take control of up to two enemy monsters until the end of the turn. If this card is destroyed, draw 3 cards.

Name: Mewtwo
Description: When this card is summoned, deal 600 damage to yourself. If this card is destroyed, you can add one “Mewtwo” card from your deck to your hand. Reduce its mana cost by 2.

Name: Pokemon Ghost
Flavour: Many years ago, this was a beloved Pokemon. It wanders the Earth searching for its former master.

Name: Rainy Day
Description: It is raining. The attack of fire type monsters are reduced by 100.

Name: Harsh Sunlight
Description: The sunlight is harsh. The attacks of water type monsters is reduced by 100.

Name: Kiljoy Turret
Description: Once per turn: deal 100 damage to the opposing monster and the monsters adjacent to it.

Name: Sun Avatar
Description: At the beginning of your turn: this card turns into True Sun God.

Name: True Sun God
Flavour: There can be only one.
Description: When this card is summoned, send all monsters from either side of the field to the graveyard. This card’s original attack and health becomes their total attack and health, plus 600/1000.

Name: `Mew`. the First Pokemon
Flavour: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
Description: Once per turn, you can pay 1 mana, this card’s effect becomes another face-up monster’s effect for rest this turn.

Name: Lake of Rage `Gyarados`
Flavour: This Gyarados was forced to evolve by Team Rocket. The Magikarp it evolves from retains its red color, having no time to change its scale color to blue.
Description: This card can only be summoned by tributing a “Magikarp” you control. When this card is summoned, reduce the attack of each of your opponent’s monsters by 100.

Name: `Arceus`, the Creator
Flavour: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across the world. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.
Description: Once while face-up on the field: Send all other cards on the field to the graveyard.

Name: `Mewtwo` Strikes Back
Flavour: The circumstances of one's birth are irrelevant: it is what one does with life that determines one's destiny
Description: When this card is summoned, deal 600 damage to yourself. If this card is destroyed, you can add one “Mewtwo” card from your deck to your hand. Reduce its mana cost by 2.

Name: Ambertwo
Flavour: Both Mew and Amber were successfully cloned, and while they were growing inside test tubes, Mewtwo became friends with Ambertwo telepathically. As Ambertwo disappears, she thanks Mewtwo for caring about her and tells him “life is wonderful".
Description: When this card is summoned, you can send one of your cards from your field to the graveyard. Heal life points equal to 3 times that card’s attack.
